Description: Pottery oil-lamp. Egyptian 'Frog type' with carinated body. Made in plaster mould, with moulded decoration on the top. Branches extending from a rectangular feature at rear, bosses and depressions, a nozzle defined by incised triple ridges and grooves on nozzle-top. The base has a base-ring and 'alpha' impressed. The nozzle shows traces of burning through use. Pale yellow (marl?) clay fabric with light buff surface, fine mica, quartz, white and dark grey inclusions.
Curator's comments: ‘Corn’ or ‘palm-branch’ lamps are contemporary and related to and often conflated with, or a considered a subtype of ‘frog lamps’, previously thought to date to the 3rd to 4th centuries AD (Bailey 1988). Egyptian decorated ‘frog lamp’ parallels all in a buff clay have been found in Alexandria, Elephantine, Buto, Deir-el-Medineh, Karanis and Kom el-Dikka (Bailey 1988, 264-5, Q2187-2190). Parallels from Quseir (Peacock 2011, nos 29,20 and 32) were found in mid 2nd to early 3rd century AD deposits (Van Rengen & Thomas 2006, 149). Parallels from Mons Claudianus were found in deposits dated to the Hadrianic period, or mid 2nd century AD (Knowles 2006, Type nos 27-35). Close parallel said to be from Szombathely, Hungary (Iványi 1935, 1024). Parallels in the British Museum include: AES 1864.0915.3 from Elephantine, 1867.0915.56 from Alexandria, 1984,0326.2 from Tell el-Farain (Buto) and GR 1987,0402.24 and 1986,1208.8 from Egypt. Other examples were also found at Naukratis (British Museum PE 1886,0401.1358 OA4343; Bolton 1886.31.10, and a later variant 1886.31.73). 2nd to early 4th century AD parallel from Tell Atrib (Młynarczyk 2012, type TA III.2). Iványi , D. 1935. Die pannonischen lampen. Budapest. Knowles, K. 2006. The pottery lamps. In V.A.Maxfield and D.P.S. Peacock Survey and excavation at Mons Claudianus 1987-1993. Vol. 3 Ceramic vessels and related objects. IFAO Cairo. 309–426. Młynarczyk, J. 2012. Tell Atrib 1985-1995. Vol. 3: Terracotta oil lamps. Varsovie: Éditions Neriton. Peacock D. P. S. 2011. Ceramic lamps, in D. P. S. Peacock & L. Blue (eds), Myos Hormos - Quseir al-Qadim. Roman and Islamic ports on the Red Sea. Volume 2: Finds from the 1999-2003 season, Oxford: Archaeopress, BAR International Series 2286. 47-56. Shier, L.A. 1978. Terracotta lamps from Karanis, Egypt. Ann Arbor. Rengen, W. & R. I. Thomas, R.
